str2: The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A son, descendent. Apparently a primary word; a 'son', used very widely of immediate, remote or figuratively, kinship.
Zebedee, father of the apostles James and John. Of Hebrew origin; Zebedaeus, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To come to, approach. From pros and poreuomai; to journey towards, i.e. Approach.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
A teacher, master. From didasko; an instructor.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To ask, request, petition, demand. Of uncertain derivation; to ask.
